questions.question: Which definition best matches the term 'barcode'?
options: a type of input device that is used to capture data from its immediate environment.
technology that can convert hard copy text or images into a digital format to be stored in a computer memory
a series of dark and light lines of varying thickness used to represent data; the code has to be scanned using laser or LED light source
a pointing device that uses a red LED to track the movement of the device and then relays its coordinates to a computer
questions.answer: a series of dark and light lines of varying thickness used to represent data; the code has to be scanned using laser or LED light source

questions.question: Which definition best matches the term 'sensor'?
options: technology that can convert hard copy text or images into a digital format to be stored in a computer memory
a type of input device that is used to capture data from its immediate environment.
a pointing device that uses a red LED to track the movement of the device and then relays its coordinates to a computer
a series of dark and light lines of varying thickness used to represent data; the code has to be scanned using laser or LED light source
questions.answer: a type of input device that is used to capture data from its immediate environment.

questions.question: A _______ scanner is used to read barcodes made of dark and light parallel lines that represent digits using specific patterns.
What component in a digital camera converts light into an electrical signal?
Which of the following input devices works by detecting air vibrations and converting them into an electric signal?
Which technology is used by most touch screens to detect user interaction by changes in electric fields?
Which scanning technology can convert hard copy text or images into a digital format for computer storage?
In a keyboard, pressing a key completes a circuit that the CPU detects and matches to a character using its _______ value.
An _______ mouse is a pointing device that uses a red LED to track movement and relays its coordinates to the computer.
Match the device to its primary function

pairs.2D Scanner: Converts physical documents into digital images
pairs.QR Code: Can hold thousands of characters or digits in a square-shaped block matrix
pairs.Barcode Scanner: Used to read lines representing digits with a laser or LED
pairs.Digital Camera: Captures images by converting light through a lens and sensor

questions.question: What is the primary function of the alignment squares in QR codes?
options: To store the main data content
To help the scanner determine position and angle
To increase storage capacity to 7089 digits
questions.answer: To help the scanner determine position and angle

questions.question: In digital cameras, what converts the electric signal from pixels into a digital image?
Which definition best matches the term 'output device'?
options: a device that can be used to obtain the results of data that has been processed.
inkjet printer technology whereby tiny resistors create heat and form an ink bubble which is ejected onto paper in an inkjet printer
a 3D printing technique in which the print head moves in the x, y and z directions
a 3D printing method that uses a two-stage pass; the first stage uses dry powder and second stage uses a binding agent
questions.answer: a device that can be used to obtain the results of data that has been processed.

questions.question: Which definition best matches the term 'actuator'?
options: inkjet printer technology whereby tiny resistors create heat and form an ink bubble which is ejected onto paper in an inkjet printer
a 3D printing technique in which the print head moves in the x, y and z directions
a device that can be used to obtain the results of data that has been processed.
an output device that converts electrical energy into mechanical movement
questions.answer: an output device that converts electrical energy into mechanical movement

questions.question: Which projection technology uses thousands of tiny mirrors to reflect light and form an image?
Which method is NOT used by 3D printers according to the notes?
How does a thermal bubble inkjet printer form an image on paper?
options: Ink bubbles are created by heat and ejected
Dry toner is fused with heat
questions.answer: Ink bubbles are created by heat and ejected

questions.question: A _______ converts electric current into sound, producing output by vibrating a cone to move air.
_______ screens use organic compounds that emit light when powered and do not need backlighting.
__________ is inkjet printer technology whereby tiny resistors create heat and form an ink bubble which is ejected onto paper.
In laser printers, what makes the print permanent on paper?
options: Toner powder sticking to charged areas
A heated roller called a fuser melting the toner
Laser scanning to remove charge patterns
questions.answer: A heated roller called a fuser melting the toner

questions.question: Match the output device to its technology or method

pairs.Inkjet Printer: Uses vibrating crystals or heat to eject ink droplets
pairs.Laser Printer: Uses dry toner powder and static electricity
pairs.OLED Screen: Uses organic compounds that emit light when powered
pairs.Actuator: Converts electrical energy into mechanical movement

questions.question: What does an analogue-to-digital converter (ADC) do in the context of sensor data?
options: Converts digital signals to mechanical movement
Converts analogue data from sensors into digital data
questions.answer: Converts analogue data from sensors into digital data

questions.question: Which type of sensor is used in greenhouses, heating systems, and digital thermometers?
A _______ sensor measures how acidic or alkaline a substance is and is used in soil testing.
Sensors do not make decisions; they simply send data to a _______ for processing and action.
Which statement best describes how sensors work in feedback control systems?
options: Sensors make independent decisions and adjust outputs directly
Sensors detect changes and send data to microprocessors for decision-making
Sensors only work when environmental changes exceed preset thresholds
Sensors convert digital signals to analogue for continuous monitoring
questions.answer: Sensors detect changes and send data to microprocessors for decision-making

questions.question: Match each sensor type with its primary application

pairs.Gas sensor: Detects leaks or measures oxygen/carbon dioxide levels
pairs.Proximity sensor: Detects nearby objects in parking or mobile phone screens
pairs.Accelerometer: Detects motion changes in airbag systems
pairs.Flow sensor: Measures gas or liquid movement in hospital devices
